value.title: Power BI Paginated Reports: Visualizing Data
value.excerpt: Paginated reports in Power BI are now available. Now that you have data, Patrick walks you through how to build a matrix visual within the report. He also looks at how to work with expressions and formatting.  LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in a Cube -- https://guyinacube.com -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube --
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/gleYD97WScI" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

images.title: Power BI Paginated Reports: Visualizing Data

value.title: Power BI User lookup with the gateway using Active Directory
value.excerpt: In this video, Adam looks at how you can use Active Directory custom attributes for the user lookup with the Power BI Gateway. This can be used for both Analysis Services mapping and the Kerberos SSO with DirectQuery connections.  Manage your data source - Analysis Services https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/service-gateway-enterprise-manage-ssas#usernames-with-analysis-services
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/NG05PG9aiRw" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

images.title: Power BI User lookup with the gateway using Active Directory

value.title: Ragged Hierarchies in Analysis Services with Power BI and Excel
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick looks at the ragged hierarchy problem within Excel and Power BI when you are pulling data from Analysis Services. He looks at how you can correct the issue easily within Excel and some alternatives for Power BI.  LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in a Cube -- https://guyinacube.com -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/4Km6HmydY7A" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

images.title: Ragged Hierarchies in Analysis Services with Power BI and Excel

value.title: Report level measures with Power BI live connections
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick looks at how you can create report level measures, within Power BI Desktop, against SQL Server Analysis Services Tabular live connections, or against a Power BI service dataset live connection. He also explains what is meant by report level measures. Bust out your DAX toolbelt
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/Yezgr3QN9hw" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

images.title: Report level measures with Power BI live connections

value.title: STOP refreshing a single table at a time! (Power BI Desktop)
value.excerpt: Stop refreshing one table at a time! Also, don't wait for the entire data model to finish refreshing. Refresh multiple tables within Power BI Desktop.  Gilbert Q's Blog: https://www.fourmoo.com/2020/04/22/how-to-refresh-selected-not-all-tables-in-power-bi-desktop/  ðŸ“¢ Become a member: https://guyinacu.be/membership

value.title: Tooltips, tooltips, tooltips in Power BI
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick shows how you can display multiple values within a tooltip for a visual. He walks through the DAX measure and also shows some pitfalls to look out for when it comes to filter context.  Go here for the sample DAX statement: https://guyinacube.com/2017/06/tooltips-tooltips-tooltips-power-bi/
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/D6mGoPNDwNk" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

images.title: Tooltips, tooltips, tooltips in Power BI

value.title: Using Single Sign-on with the Power BI Gateway
value.excerpt: Let's dig into the Power BI gateway and Single Sign-On (SSO) using Kerberos!  This can be used for both DirectQuery and refreshing a Power BI dataset. value.title: What the HECK is a Power BI Gateway Cluster?

value.title: What the heck is USERPRINCIPALNAME in Power BI? (Row-Level Security)
value.excerpt: Ever wonder what USERPRINCIPALNAME is in DAX within Power BI? Or the difference between USERPRINCIPALNAME and USERNAME? Hint - It's used with Row-Level Security.  New Row-Level Security course from Guy in a Cube - https://guyinacu.be/courses  ðŸ“¢ Become a member: https://guyinacu.be/membership   *******************

value.title: PowerBI.Tips - Tutorial - ALM ToolKit with Christian Wade

Christian Wade has been generous enough to provide us with a detailed tutorial on the ALM ToolKit.    ALM Toolkit provides the following features: - Database Compare - Code Merging - Easy Deployments - Source-Control

value.title: Get the Day of the Week Name and Number in Power BI Using DAX
value.excerpt: If you don't have a date table with a column that represents the day of the week name (Saturday, Sunday, Monday etc) or number (from zero to six, or from one to seven), and you just have a date field, which you want to quickly get the day name of the week, here is a quick trick for you. Read my blog

value.title: What Do You Need to Implement Dynamic Row Level Security in Power BI
value.excerpt: I have explained in some videos about the RLS topic already. Through my consulting experience, however, I get the feeling that many people canâ€™t easily move from static RLS to dynamic. If you know what are things you need to have the dynamic RLS implemented, it makes the whole process simple. So this

value.title: Introducing Performance Analyzer in Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: Performance Analyzer is the first diagnostic tool to find the slower parts of a report. Find the slowest DAX query before starting a deeper investigation using DAX Studio. How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/ DAX Studio: https://daxstudio.org/

value.title: Year-to-date filtering weekdays in DAX
value.excerpt: Time intelligence functions oftentimes hide an automatic ALL statement meant to make time intelligence calculations easier. This video describes this behavior and what to do in case it ends up breaking your calculation. Article and download: https://sql.bi/123591
